title: autometa pipeline parameters
description: Autometa: Automated Extraction of Microbial Genomes from Shotgun Metagenomes

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to input comma-delimited sample sheet(s).
input.help_text:
Use this to specify your inputs' names, metagenomes, reads, coverage table and whether to calculate coverage from the assembly headers or from read alignments.


See https://autometa.readthedocs.io/en/latest/nextflow-workflow.html#sample-sheet-preparation for information on preparing an input sample sheet.

outdir.description: Absolute (full) path of directory where the results will be saved.

tracedir.description: Absolute (full) path of directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

publish_dir_mode.description: How should output files be stored?
publish_dir_mode.help_text:
Important note: Using a linking method (anything ending in 'link') and then deleting the nextflow run's working/cache directory will result in the loss of all output files. Links will remain but will only point to non-existent file(s).

Use one of the following
copy
    Copies the output files into the published directory. (default)
symlink
    Creates an absolute symbolic link in the published directory for each process output file.
rellink
    Creates a relative symbolic link in the published directory for each process output file.
link
    Creates a hard link in the published directory for each process output file.
copyNoFollow
    Copies the output files into the published directory without following symlinks ie. copies the links themselves.
move
    Moves the output files into the published directory. Note: this is only supposed to be used for a terminating process i.e. a process whose output is not consumed by any other downstream process.

For more information see:
https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir

length_cutoff.description: Minimum contig length to use as input to Autometa.

norm_method.description: Kmer count normalization transformation method to use. Choices are am_clr, clr, and ilr.

pca_dimensions.description: Number of dimensions of which to reduce the initial k-mer frequencies matrix

embedding_method.description: Embedding method to use. Choices are sksne, bhsne, umap, densmap, trimap.

embedding_dimensions.description: Final dimensions of the kmer frequencies matrix

kmer_size.description: kmer length to use during kmer counting

clustering_method.description: Cluster contigs using specified clustering method. Choices are dbscan and hdbscan

classification_method.description: Classification method to use for unclustered recruitment step. Choices are decision_tree and random_forest.

classification_kmer_pca_dimensions.description: Number of dimensions of which to reduce the initial k-mer frequencies matrix by PCA

completeness.description: Minimum completeness needed to keep a cluster (default is at least 20% complete)

purity.description: Minimum purity needed to keep a cluster (default is at least 95% pure)

gc_stddev_limit.description: Maximum GC% standard deviation under which a cluster is kept (default is 5%)

cov_stddev_limit.description: Maximum coverage standard deviation under which a cluster is kept (default is  25%)

unclustered_recruitment.description: Set to true for unclustered recruitment

single_db_dir.description: Directory containing databases required for taxonomy assignment

nr_dmnd_dir.description: Currently not used do not set
nr_dmnd_dir.default: Currently not used do not set

prot_accession2taxid_gz_dir.description: Currently not used do not set
prot_accession2taxid_gz_dir.default: Currently not used do not set

taxdump_tar_gz_dir.description: Currently not used do not set
taxdump_tar_gz_dir.default: Currently not used do not set

binning_starting_rank.description: Which taxonomic rank to start the binning from. Choices are superkingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus, species

kingdom.description: Bin contigs belonging to this kingdom. Choices are bacteria and archaea

large_downloads_permission.description: Can Autometa download nr.gz if needed? (It's >100Gb)
large_downloads_permission.help_text:
For more information on required databases and configuration...

see: https://autometa.readthedocs.io/en/latest/autometa-nextflow-workflow.html#databases

autometa_nextflow_parameters.title: Autometa Nextflow Parameters
autometa_nextflow_parameters.description: These paramters control how the pipeline is executed

max_time.description: Max time a *single* process is allowed to run

use_run_name.description: If TRUE, run-name will be used in the output directory structure

debug.description: Run pipeline with small defaults (e.g. not the entire nr.gz download)

autometa_image_tag.description: Change which tag of the autometa docker image is used

generic_nf_core_options.title: Generic nf-core options
generic_nf_core_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
generic_nf_core_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

validate_params.description: Whether to validate parameters on initiation

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

config_profile_url.description: Only used for institutional-based profiles. See https://nf-co.re/usage/tutorials/step_by_step_institutional_profile#params-scope for more information
